div.pre: 1521 Saida (anc. Sidon), Phoenicia, before 1954 Burial: c. 300 B.C. (Westermark) Contents: 23+ AR. Pot hoard. Found at entrance to city of Sidon Thracian Chersonesus: 17 hemidr. Amisus: 6 dr. and hemidr. Disposition: dispersed Rubbings in ANS Among the rubbings were a dr. of Rhodes and a tetrob. of Histiaea. As both seem to be 2nd cent. B.C., they are presum- ably intrusive
